subject: Politics
title: The Russian Revolution
description: A quick, practical guide to The Russian Revolution.

hook.text: Russia went from czar to communist utopia to Stalinist nightmare in a decade. Revolution rarely ends where it begins.

buildup.text: By 1917, Russia was losing a world war, food was scarce, and the czar had lost all legitimacy.

discovery.text: Lenin's Bolsheviks seized power in October 1917 promising 'Peace, Land, and Bread.' They delivered none quickly.

twist.text: Stalin replaced Lenin and built a totalitarian state. Millions died in purges, famines, and forced labor camps.

climax.text: The revolution that promised worker liberation created one of history's most repressive regimes.

punchline.text: Russia's revolution freed no one. It replaced one tyranny with another.

quiz.question: What did the Bolsheviks promise when they seized power?
